TopicTitle: [WIP] [1.0.5] (Dev Paused) QuizTech Aero Pack v1.2.9.x | Updated: 8/9/15 |

Articles.Content: Is there a way for me to add support for nuFAR, or remove whatever data conflicts with it? I really love these cockpits and engines, but I can't use them with my FAR install!

I am not sure if Mr Quiznos has set up FAR configs for the parts yet.

I think it'll be some time until everyone is on board with the next gen FAR

Is there a way for me to add support for nuFAR, or remove whatever data conflicts with it? I really love these cockpits and engines, but I can't use them with my FAR install!

Running nuFAR without problems.

P.S. Those are some cool crafts that you posted DeepSlayLP

Thanks

For some reason if I try and fly a plane which uses phoenix wing engines placed using mirror symmetry my plane does an uncontrollable barrel roll. Is this just me or is it a bug with the mod?

Edited May 17, 2015 by volcanicshrimp
I don't think so. But it's annoying. You just have to toggle 'Set Reverse Thrust' on one wing (mostly the opposite one) and it should fix it.

I did that. I was flying with the engines facing forwards.

After more testing it appears to be a bug with dynamic deflection inverting the roll axis and not telling the SAS system!

Edited May 17, 2015 by volcanicshrimp

I stated in the change log that the folder for that piece was renamed, so you will have to delete and re-install QuizTechAero. I'll put another note on the OP.

only the mk2 probe core shows up and no other parts

Please make sure you have thoroughly followed the instructions in the ReadMe.txt. If you still have issues then let me know.

FAR doesn't seem to be voxelizing the twin turbojet properly, and I suspect it has to do with not detecting the nozzle exits correctly (and thus considering the part hollow). Is there something different about the way the nozzles are constructed on the twin turbojet compared do the other engines?

Notice that the nozzle exit is filled with voxels on the K35-B, whereas it is empty on the twin turbojet.

FAR doesn't seem to be voxelizing the twin turbojet properly, and I suspect it has to do with not detecting the nozzle exits correctly (and thus considering the part hollow). Is there something different about the way the nozzles are constructed on the twin turbojet compared do the other engines?

http://i274.photobucket.com/albums/jj251/blowfishpro/KSP/Debug/screenshot4_zpsjrm6zzf4.png

http://i274.photobucket.com/albums/jj251/blowfishpro/KSP/Debug/screenshot5_zpsgjvewad7.png

Notice that the nozzle exit is filled with voxels on the K35-B, whereas it is empty on the twin turbojet.

Hmm interesting.. How are the voxels calculated by nuFAR? The main difference is that each "flap" that makes up the nozzle is its own object. Same with the inner ring of flaps. I did that so that the animation would be possible (which I just remembered that I forgot to enable again...*sigh*). It also uses two thrustTransforms, both named the same, and both of those are underneath their own objGimbal.
So ferram4 and I figured out that the problem is that the colliders are not closed. Make the colliders into solid objects and the problem should be fixed

So ferram4 and I figured out that the problem is that the colliders are not closed. Make the colliders into solid objects and the problem should be fixed

Ah I see, easy enough fix Thanks, I'll put it on the list for the next update. Does this only apply to engines? I have some other parts that use open colliders as well.

How about add two sticks. Like F-35B

Like this.

Without this stick, it`s too simple.

Ah I see, easy enough fix Thanks, I'll put it on the list for the next update. Does this only apply to engines? I have some other parts that use open colliders as well.

What I've heard is that it's better in general if colliders are solid (and this applies to more than just FAR) but I haven't encountered any other specific issues yet.

What I've heard is that it's better in general if colliders are solid (and this applies to more than just FAR) but I haven't encountered any other specific issues yet.

Awesome!!!!! Finally a dual-nuke engine!

Side-note: Can someone make a tutorial on how to properly set up the vtol wing fan thingys?

Awesome!!!!! Finally a dual-nuke engine!

Side-note: Can someone make a tutorial on how to properly set up the vtol wing fan thingys?

I set up the wing so that the side with the flag is "up", so the default thrustTransform is pointing opposite of the flag side. When you place the wings in symmetry you then have to reverse the thrust on the wing that now has the flag pointed at the floor. If you first place a wing upside down then you will have to reverse that one and leave the other at default.
